greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Least odd number that requires n Collatz (3x+1) iterations to reach 1, or zero if there is no such number.
comment: Both the 3x+1 steps and the halving steps are counted. a(n)=0 only for n = 1, 2, 3, 4, 6, 8, and 10. Sequence A033491 gives the least even or odd number requiring n iterations.
link: T. D. Noe, Table of n, a(n) for n=0..1924
results.author: _T. D. Noe_, Apr 27 2010
